definition: that cannot be forgiven or excused
to give somebody the desire, confidence or enthusiasm to do something well
to give somebody the idea for something, especially something artistic or that shows imagination
to make somebody have a particular feeling or emotion
written or said at the beginning of something as an introduction to what follows
intended as an introduction to a subject or an activity for people who have never done it before
offered for a short time only, when a product is first on sale
that can be checked to show whether it is true or accurate
to slide forward or to one side in a way that shows a loss of control
a small curved tube inside the ear that contains a small part that sends nerve signals to the brain when sounds cause it to vibrate
a meeting attended by all the members of a committee, etc.; a plenary meeting
the fact of not being possible
something that is not possible
the act of taking part in something or dealing with somebody
the act of giving a lot of time and attention to something you care about
a close relationship with somebody, especially a romantic or sexual relationship with somebody that you are not married to
the practice of giving birth to a baby for another person or couple, usually because they are unable to have babies themselves
to be enough for somebody/something
used to suggest that although you could say more, what you do say will be enough to explain what you mean
a net worn over the hair to keep it in place
(in writing) millimetre
with added minerals and salts, intended to replace those lost during exercise
a large jug used in the past for carrying water
a container with a handle and a lip, for holding and pouring liquids
a large clay container with a small opening and one or two handles, used, especially in the past, for holding liquids
the player who throws the ball to the batter
the quality of being different from other people and doing things in your own way
the belief that individual people in society should have the right to make their own decisions, etc., rather than be controlled by the government
a part of an aircraft’s wing that can be raised in order to interrupt the flow of air over it and so slow the aircraft’s speed
a raised part on a fast car that prevents it from being lifted off the road when travelling very fast
a candidate for a political office who is unlikely to win but who may get enough votes to prevent one of the main candidates from winning
a person or thing that intends or is intended to stop somebody/something being successful
information that you are given about what is going to happen in a film, television series, etc. before it is shown to the public
a news story, book, etc. that is produced very quickly in order to take attention away from one produced by a competitor that appears at the same time
a place where something is missing in a piece of writing or in an idea, a theory, etc.
the study of the rules for the position of phonemes in a language
